intro: Pisum sativum var. majale, commonly known as the large-seeded pea, is a variety of the common pea plant characterized by its notably larger seeds compared to standard pea varieties. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, producing clusters of purple flowers that develop into pods containing several seeds. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and a fibrous root system, making it well-suited for cultivation in various soil types. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and is often used in both culinary and agricultural contexts.
